body: One of the greatest perks of Christianity in Medieval Europe was people had half the year off due to saints days.
body_html: One of the greatest perks of Christianity in Medieval Europe was people had half the year off due to saints days.
title: We need more Christian Holidays

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
The correct solution is not to worship saints but give more time off.

That said people in those days worked brutal jobs and were practically slaves, so they needed more time off. Plus the world was a LOT slower paced whereas today we need as many people as possible doing everything very quickly and even that is never good enough.
body_html:
The correct solution is not to worship saints but give more time off.

That said people in those days worked brutal jobs and were practically slaves, so they needed more time off. Plus the world was a LOT slower paced whereas today we need as many people as possible doing everything very quickly and even that is never good enough.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

post.title: We need more Christian Holidays

body:
a lot of time might have been spent praying or going to church on these holidays too (something to keep in mind as to where that time would go to)

I agree that there is a need for more Christian holidays, I've found some that I could post about if you'd like me to try to list more of them, like [Michaelmas](https://infogalactic.com/info/Michaelmas) - it's a cultural thing, these "feast" days exist with Catholicism but not necessarily corresponding festivals and events although they could be revived
body_html:
